comments:
I am running latest dev build and it is failing with this error: Unable to retrieve query results from http://jira.codehaus.org/ The reference to entity "pid" must end with the ';' delimiter.

Those are printed to stdout and query lost all the hits.

[Fatal Error] :8:82: The reference to entity "updated" must end with the ';' delimiter.
[Fatal Error] :8:78: The reference to entity "pid" must end with the ';' delimiter.

For some reason JIRA returns this feed. I won't have chance to look at this deeper any time soon.
----

<!--  RSS generated by JIRA (Enterprise Edition, Version: 3.7.2-#186) at Fri Mar 02 12:04:28 CST 2007 -->
<!-- If you wish to do custom client-side styling of RSS, uncomment this:
<?xml-stylesheet href="http://jira.codehaus.org/styles/jirarss2html.xsl" type="text/xsl"?>
-->
<rss version="0.92" >
<channel>
    <title>(jira.codehaus.org)</title>
    <link>(http://jira.codehaus.org/secure/IssueNavigator.jspa?reset=true&pid=11093&sorter/field=issuekey&sorter/order=DESC)</link>
    <description>An XML representation of a search request</description>
    <language>en</language>
....


org.xml.sax.SAXParseException: The reference to entity "pid" must end with the ';' delimiter.
	at com.sun.org.apache.xerces.internal.parsers.AbstractSAXParser.parse(AbstractSAXParser.java:1269)
	at org.eclipse.mylar.internal.jira.core.service.web.rss.RssReader.readRssFeed(RssReader.java:45)
	at org.eclipse.mylar.internal.jira.core.service.web.rss.RssFeedProcessorCallback.execute(RssFeedProcessorCallback.java:135)
	at org.eclipse.mylar.internal.jira.core.service.web.JiraWebSession.doInSession(JiraWebSession.java:58)
	at org.eclipse.mylar.internal.jira.core.service.web.rss.RssJiraFilterService.findIssues(RssJiraFilterService.java:50)
	at org.eclipse.mylar.internal.jira.core.service.soap.SoapJiraService.findIssues(SoapJiraService.java:460)
	at org.eclipse.mylar.internal.jira.core.service.CachedRpcJiraServer.search(CachedRpcJiraServer.java:508)
	at org.eclipse.mylar.internal.jira.ui.JiraRepositoryConnector.performQuery(JiraRepositoryConnector.java:143)
	at org.eclipse.mylar.tasks.ui.SynchronizeQueryJob.run(SynchronizeQueryJob.java:91)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.Worker.run(Worker.java:58)
Steffen: are you also seeing this problem?  My JIRA queries seem to be working, but I only have a couple for JIRA Dashboard.

(In reply to comment #2)
> Steffen: are you also seeing this problem?  My JIRA queries seem to be working,
> but I only have a couple for JIRA Dashboard.

Codehaus JIRA was busted, but they seem fixed it now.
Though it may make sense to use something less sensitive then xml parser to parse jira rss feeds. Maybe ROME...
I'm expecting that we will get Rome approved within the Europa/2.0 timeframe.
Seems to be fixed on the Codehaus side.
